<span class="cit-article-title">A chromosome-based draft sequence of the hexaploid bread wheat (<em>Triticum aestivum</em>) genome</span>. <abbr class="cit-jnl-abbrev">Science</abbr> 
<span class="cit-vol">345</span>, 
<span class="cit-fpage">1251788</span> (<span class="cit-pub-date">2014</span>).<span class="cit-pub-id-sep cit-pub-id-doi-sep"> </span><span class="cit-pub-id cit-pub-id-doi"><span class="cit-pub-id-scheme-doi">doi:</span>10.1126/science.1251788</span><span class="cit-pub-id cit-pub-id-pmid"><span class="cit-pub-id-scheme-pmid">pmid:</span>25035500</span></cite></div><div class="cit-extra"><a href="{openurl}?query=rft.jtitle%253DScience%26rft.stitle%253DScience%26rft.aulast%253DThe%2BInternational%2BWheat%2BGenome%2BSequencing%2BConsorti%26rft.auinit1%253D%2B%26rft.volume%253D345%26rft.issue%253D6194%26rft.spage%253D1251788%26rft.epage%253D1251788%26rft.atitle%253DA%2Bchromosome-based%2Bdraft%2Bsequence%2Bof%2Bthe%2Bhexaploid%2Bbread%2Bwheat%2B%2528Triticum%2Baestivum%2529%2Bgenome%26rft_id%253Dinfo%253Adoi%252F10.1126%252Fscience.1251788%26rft_id%253Dinfo%253Apmid%252F25035500%26rft.genre%253Darticle%26rft_val_fmt%253Dinfo%253Aofi%252Ffmt%253Akev%253Amtx%253Ajournal%26ctx_ver%253DZ39.88-2004%26url_ver%253DZ39.88-2004%26url_ctx_fmt%253Dinfo%253Aofi%252Ffmt%253Akev%253Amtx%253Actx" class="cit-ref-sprinkles cit-ref-sprinkles-openurl cit-ref-sprinkles-open-url"><span>OpenUrl</span></a><a href="" class="cit-ref-sprinkles cit-ref-sprinkles-ijlink"><span><span class="cit-reflinks-abstract">Abstract</span><span class="cit-sep cit-reflinks-variant-name-sep">/</span><span class="cit-reflinks-full-text"><span class="free-full-text">FREE </span>Full Text</span></span></a></div></div></li><li><span class="ref-label">7.</span><a class="rev-xref-ref" href="#xref-ref-7-1" title="View reference 7 in text" id="ref-7">↵</a><div class="cit ref-cit ref-journal" id="cit-361.6403.eaar7191.7" data-doi="10.1186/s13059-015-0582-8"><div class="cit-metadata"><ol class="cit-auth-list"><li><span class="cit-auth"> <span class="cit-name-given-names">J. A.</span> <span class="cit-name-surname">Chapman</span></span>, </li><li><span class="cit-auth"> <span class="cit-name-given-names">M.</span> <span class="cit-name-surname">Mascher</span></span>, </li><li><span class="cit-auth"> <span class="cit-name-given-names">A.</span> <span class="cit-name-surname">Buluç</span></span>, </li><li><span class="cit-auth"> <span class="cit-name-given-names">K.</span> <span class="cit-name-surname">Barry</span></span>, </li><li><span class="cit-auth"> <span class="cit-name-given-names">E.</span> <span class="cit-name-surname">Georganas</span></span>, </li><li><span class="cit-auth"> <span class="cit-name-given-names">A.</span> <span class="cit-name-surname">Session</span></span>, </li><li><span class="cit-auth"> <span class="cit-name-given-names">V.</span> <span class="cit-name-surname">Strnadova</span></span>, </li><li><span class="cit-auth"> <span class="cit-name-given-names">J.</span> <span class="cit-name-surname">Jenkins</span></span>, </li><li><span class="cit-auth"> <span class="cit-name-given-names">S.</span> <span class="cit-name-surname">Sehgal</span></span>, </li><li><span class="cit-auth"> <span class="cit-name-given-names">L.</span> <span class="cit-name-surname">Oliker</span></span>, </li><li><span class="cit-auth"> <span class="cit-name-given-names">J.</span> <span class="cit-name-surname">Schmutz</span></span>, </li><li><span class="cit-auth"> <span class="cit-name-given-names">K. S.</span> <span class="cit-name-surname">Rokhsar</span></span></li></ol><cite>,

<span class="cit-fpage">4</span> (<span class="cit-pub-date">2013</span>).<span class="cit-pub-id-sep cit-pub-id-doi-sep"> </span><span class="cit-pub-id cit-pub-id-doi"><span class="cit-pub-id-scheme-doi">doi:</span>10.1186/1939-8433-6-4</span><span class="cit-pub-id cit-pub-id-pmid"><span class="cit-pub-id-scheme-pmid">pmid:</span>24280374</span></cite></div><div class="cit-extra"><a href="{openurl}?query=rft.jtitle%253DRice%2B%2528N.%2BY.%2529%26rft.volume%253D6%26rft.spage%253D4%26rft_id%253Dinfo%253Adoi%252F10.1186%252F1939-8433-6-4%26rft_id%253Dinfo%253Apmid%252F24280374%26rft.genre%253Darticle%26rft_val_fmt%253Dinfo%253Aofi%252Ffmt%253Akev%253Amtx%253Ajournal%26ctx_ver%253DZ39.88-2004%26url_ver%253DZ39.88-2004%26url_ctx_fmt%253Dinfo%253Aofi%252Ffmt%253Akev%253Amtx%253Actx" class="cit-ref-sprinkles cit-ref-sprinkles-openurl cit-ref-sprinkles-open-url"><span>OpenUrl</span></a><a href="/lookup/external-ref?access_num=10.1186/1939-8433-6-4&amp;link_type=DOI" class="cit-ref-sprinkles cit-ref-sprinkles-doi cit-ref-sprinkles-crossref"><span>CrossRef</span></a><a href="/lookup/external-ref?access_num=24280374&amp;link_type=MED&amp;atom=%2Fsci%2F361%2F6403%2Feaar7191.atom" class="cit-ref-sprinkles cit-ref-sprinkles-medline"><span>PubMed</span></a></div></div></li></ol></div><div class="ack"><strong>Acknowledgments: </strong>The IWGSC would like to thank the following individuals: M. Burrell and C. Bridson (Norwich Biosciences Institute) for computational support of RNA-seq data; I. Christie (Graminor AS) and H. Rudi (Norwegian University of Life Sciences) for assistance with chromosome 7B; R. P. Davey (Earlham Institute) for assistance with RNA-seq data; J. Deek (Tel Aviv University) for growing the source plants and DNA extraction used for whole-genome sequencing; Z. Dubská, E. Jahnová, M. Seifertová, R. Šperková, R. Tušková, and J. Weiserová (Institute of Experimental Botany, Olomouc) for assistance with flow cytometric chromosome sorting, BAC library construction, and estimation of genome size; S. Durand, V. Jamilloux, M. Lainé, and C. Michotey (URGI, INRA) for assistance with and access to the IWGSC sequence repository; A. Fiebig of the Leibniz Institute of Plant Genetics and Crop Plant Research (IPK) for submitting the Hi-C data; T. Florio for the design of the wheat schematic for the expression atlas and <em>SSt1</em> figure (<a href="http://www.flozbox.com/Science_Illustrated">www.flozbox.com/Science_Illustrated</a>); C. Karunakaran and T. Bond of the Canadian Light Source for performing CT imaging; J. Kawai, N. Kondo, H. Sano, N. Suzuki, M. Tagami, and H. Tarui of RIKEN for assistance with deep sequencing of chromosome 6B; H. Fujisawa, Y. Katayose, K. Kurita, S. Mori, Y. Mukai, and H. Sasaki of the Institute of Crop Science, NARO for assistance with deep sequencing of chromosome 6B; T. Matsumoto of Tokyo University of Agriculture for assistance with deep sequencing of chromosome 6B; P. Lenoble and C. Orvain of Genoscope for assistance in the sequencing of chromosome 1B; A. J. Lukaszewski of the University of California, Riverside, and B. Friebe and J. Raupp of Kansas State University for providing seeds of wheat telosomic lines for chromosome sorting; C. Maulis (<a href="https://polytypo.design">https://polytypo.design</a>; <a href="https://propepper.net">https://propepper.net</a>) for design and graphics of the prolamin superfamily chromosome map; M. Seifertová and H. Tvardíková of the Institute of Experimental Botany for assistance with BAC DNA extraction and sequencing for chromosomes 3DS, 4A, and 7DS; and I. Willick and K. Tanino of the University of Saskatchewan for their assistance in sample preparation and the use of lab facilities. <strong>Funding:</strong> The authors would like to thank the following for their financial support of research that enabled the completion of the IWGSC RefSeq v1.0 Project: Agence Nationale pour la Recherche (ANR), ANR-11-BSV5-0015–Ploid-Ploid Wheat–Unravelling bases of polyploidy success in wheat and ANR-16-TERC-0026-01–3DWHEAT; Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada National Wheat Improvement Program and the AgriFlex Program; Alberta Wheat Development Commission through the Canadian Applied Tricticum Genomics (CTAG2); Australian Government, Department of Industry, Innovation, Climate Change, Science, Research, and Tertiary Education, Australia China Science and Research Fund Group Mission (Funding Agreement ACSRF00542); Australian Research Council Centre of Excellence in Plant Energy Biology (CE140100008); Australian Research Council Laureate Fellowship (FL140100179); Bayer CropScience; Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council (BBSRC) 20:20 Wheat (project number BB/J00426X/1), Institute Strategic Programme grant (BB/J004669/1), Designing Future Wheat (DFW) Institute Strategic Programme (BB/P016855/1), the Wheat Genomics for Sustainable Agriculture (BB/J003557/1), and the Anniversary Future Leader Fellowship (BB/M014045/1); Canada First Research Excellence Fund through the Designing Crops for Global Food Security initiative at the University of Saskatchewan; Council for Agricultural Research and Economics, Italy, through CREA-Interomics; Department of Biotechnology, Ministry of Science and Technology, Government of India File No. F grant no. BT/IWGSC/03/TF/2008; DFG (SFB924) for support of KFXM; European Commission through the <em>TriticeaeGenome</em> (FP7-212019); France Génomique (ANR-10-INBS-09) Genome Canada through the CTAG2 project; Genome Prairie through the CTAG2 project; German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD) PPP Australien 1j16; German Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture grant 2819103915 WHEATSEQ; German Ministry of Education and Research grant 031A536 de.NBI; Global Institute for Food Security Genomics and Bioinformatics fund; Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation grant GBMF4725 to Two Blades Foundation; Grain Research Development Corporation (GRDC) Australia; Graminor AS NFR project 199387, Expanding the technology base for Norwegian wheat breeding; Sequencing wheat chromosome 7B; illumina; INRA, French National Institute for Agricultural Research; International Wheat Genome Sequencing Consortium and its sponsors; Israel Science Foundation grants 999/12, 1137/17, and 1824/12; Junta de Andalucía, Spain, project P12-AGR-0482; MINECO (Spanish Ministry of Economy, Industry, and Competitiveness) project BIO2011-15237-E; Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry, and Fisheries of Japan through Genomics for Agricultural Innovation, KGS-1003 and through Genomics-based Technology for Agricultural Improvement, NGB-1003; Ministry of Education and Science of Russian Federation project RFMEFI60414X0106 and project RFMEFI60414 X0107; Ministry of Education, Youth, and Sport of the Czech Republic award no. LO1204 (National Program of Sustainability I); Nisshin Flour Milling, Inc.; National Research Council of Canada Wheat Flagship program; Norwegian University of Life Sciences (NMBU) NFR project 199387, Expanding the technology base for Norwegian wheat breeding, Sequencing wheat chromosome 7B; National Science Foundation, United States, award (FAIN) 1339389, GPF-PG: Genome Structure and Diversity of Wheat and Its Wild Relatives, award DBI-0701916, and award IIP-1338897; Russian Science Foundation project 14-14-00161; Saskatchewan Ministry of Agriculture through the CTAG2 project; Saskatchewan Wheat Development Commission through the CTAG2 project; The Czech Science Foundation award no. 521/06/1723 (Construction of BAC library and physical mapping of the wheat chromosome 3D), award no. 521-08-1629 (Construction of BAC DNA libraries specific for chromosome 4AL and positional cloning of gene for adult plant resistance to powdery mildew in wheat), award no. P501/10/1740 (Physical map of the wheat chromosome 4AL and positional cloning of a gene for yield), award no. P501/12/2554 (Physical map of wheat chromosome arm 7DS and its use to clone a Russian wheat aphid-resistance gene), award no. P501/12/G090 (Evolution and function of complex plant genomes), award no. 14-07164S (Cloning and molecular characterization of wheat <em>QPm-tut-4A</em> gene conferring seedling and adult plant race-nonspecific powdery-mildew resistance), and award no. 13-08786S (Chromosome arm 3DS of bread wheat: Its sequence and function in allopolyploid genome); The Research Council of Norway (NFR) project 199387, Expanding the technology base for Norwegian wheat breeding; Sequencing wheat chromosome 7B; U.S. Department of Agriculture NIFA 2008-35300-04588, the University of Zurich; Western Grains Research Foundation through the CTAG2 project; Western Grains Research Foundation National Wheat Improvement Program; and the Winifred-Asbjornson Plant Science Endowment Fund. The research leading to these results has also received funding from the French Government managed by the ANR under the Investment for the Future program (BreedWheat project ANR-10-BTBR-03), from FranceAgriMer (2011-0971 and 2013-0544), French Funds to support Plant Breeding (FSOV), and INRA. Axiom genotyping was conducted on the genotyping platform GENTYANE at INRA Clermont-Ferrand (<a href="http://gentyane.clermont.inra.fr">gentyane.clermont.inra.fr</a>). This research was supported in part by the NBI Computing infrastructure for Science (CiS) group through the HPC cluster. <strong>Author contributions:</strong> See below, where authors are arranged by working group and contributions; leaders, co-leaders, and major contributors are listed alphabetically first and then other contributors follow alphabetically. <strong>Competing interests:</strong> The authors declare no competing interests. Bayer CropScience holds a patent application (WO2015000914A1) that covers the modulation of flowering time in monocots using the <em>FLC</em> gene. <strong>Data and materials availability:</strong> The IWGSC RefSeq v1.0 assembly and annotation data, physical maps for all chromosomes and chromosome arms, and all data related to this study are available in the IWGSC Data Repository hosted at URGI: <a href="https://wheat-urgi.versailles.inra.fr/Seq-Repository">https://wheat-urgi.versailles.inra.fr/Seq-Repository</a>, Assembly and annotation data are also available at ENSEMBL-Plants: <a href="https://plants.ensembl.org/Triticum_aestivum/Info/Index">https://plants.ensembl.org/Triticum_aestivum/Info/Index</a>. The BAC libraries for all chromosomes and chromosomes arms are available at the CNRGV-INRA: <a href="https://cnrgv.toulouse.inra.fr/en/Library/Wheat">https://cnrgv.toulouse.inra.fr/en/Library/Wheat</a>. Details on gene-family expansion and contraction in the genome of bread wheat cultivar Chinese Spring are provided in database S6 at <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5447/IPK/2018/5">http://dx.doi.org/10.5447/IPK/2018/5</a> (<a id="xref-ref-52-1" class="xref-bibr" href="#ref-52"><em>52</em></a>). The raw sequencing data used for de novo whole-genome assembly are available from the Sequence Read Archive under accession number SRP114784. RNA-seq data are available at SRA under accession numbers PRJEB25639, PRJEB23056, PRJNA436817, PRJEB25640, SRP133837, and PRJEB25593. Hi-C sequence data are available under accession number PRJEB25248. ChIP-seq data are available under SRA study PRJNA420988 (SRP1262229). CS bisulfite sequencing data are available under project number SRP133674 (SRR6792673 to SRR6792689). Organellar DNA sequences were deposited at NCBI GenBank (MH051715 and MH051716). Further details on data accessibility are outlined in the supplementary materials and methods.</div><span class="highwire-journal-article-marker-end"></span></div><span id="related-urls"></span></div><a href="https://science.sciencemag.org/content/361/6403/eaar7191.abstract" class="hw-link hw-link-article-abstract" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0">View Abstract</a></div>  </div>

        <h3 class="highwire-cite-title-wrapper media__headline"><a href="/content/361/6403" class="highwire-cite-linked-title" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0"><span class="highwire-cite-title">Science</span></a></h3>
                <p  class="highwire-cite-metadata minor">Vol 361, Issue 6403<br />17 August 2018 </p>
                <ul class="priority-2 variant-list"><li class="toc first"><a href="/content/361/6403.toc" class="highwire-variant-link variant-toc " title="Table of Contents" rel="alternate" type="text/html" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0">Table of Contents </a></li>

class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="176">Hirokazu Handa</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="177">Hiroyuki Kanamori</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="178">Satoshi Katagiri</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="179">Fuminori Kobayashi</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="180">Shuhei Nasuda</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="181">Tsuyoshi Tanaka</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="182">Jianzhong Wu</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="183">Federica Cattonaro</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="184">Min Jiumeng</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="185">Karl Kugler</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="186">Matthias Pfeifer</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="187">Simen Sandve</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="188">Xu Xun</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="189">Bujie Zhan</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="190">Jacqueline Batley</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="191">Philipp E. Bayer</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="192">David Edwards</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="193">Satomi Hayashi</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="194">Zuzana Tulpová</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="195">Paul Visendi</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="196">Licao Cui</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="197">Xianghong Du</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="198">Kewei Feng</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="199">Xiaojun Nie</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="200">Wei Tong</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="201">Le Wang</span></span></p>
            <p  class="highwire-cite-metadata byline"><em>Science</em><time>17 Aug 2018</time> </p>
                <div class="highwire-cite-snippet media__deck">
      <div class="highwire-markup"><div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" class="section precis" id="abstract-2" xmlns:xhtml="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><p id="p-5">The 21 annotated chromosomes of bread wheat provide a foundation for innovation in research and breeding.</p></div></div>    </div>

</article></div>  </div>

    <div class="highwire-article-citation highwire-citation-type-highwire-article" data-node-nid="714035" id="node714035--2" data-pisa="sci;361/6403/eaar7191" data-pisa-master="sci;361/6403/eaar7191" data-apath="/sci/361/6403/eaar7191.atom"><article class="highwire-cite highwire-cite-highwire-article highwire-citation-jnl-sci-toc clearfix media media--citation">
    <div class="media__body">
        <h3 class="highwire-cite-title-wrapper media__headline"><a href="/content/361/6403/eaar7191/suppl/DC1" class="highwire-cite-linked-title" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0"><div class="highwire-cite-title media__headline__title">Shifting the limits in wheat research and breeding using a fully annotated reference genome</div></a></h3>
            <p  class="highwire-cite-authors byline">By <span  class="highwire-citation-authors"><span class="highwire-citation-author first" data-delta="0">The International Wheat Genome Sequencing Consortium (IWGSC)</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="1">Rudi Appels</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="2">Kellye Eversole</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="3">Nils Stein</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="4">Catherine Feuillet</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="5">Beat Keller</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="6">Jane Rogers</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="7">Curtis J. Pozniak</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="8">Frédéric Choulet</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="9">Assaf Distelfeld</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="10">Jesse Poland</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="11">Gil Ronen</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="12">Andrew G. Sharpe</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="13">Omer Barad</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="14">Kobi Baruch</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="15">Gabriel Keeble-Gagnère</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="16">Martin Mascher</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="17">Gil Ben-Zvi</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="18">Ambre-Aurore Josselin</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="19">Axel Himmelbach</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="20">François Balfourier</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="21">Juan Gutierrez-Gonzalez</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="22">Matthew Hayden</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="23">ChuShin Koh</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="24">Gary Muehlbauer</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="25">Raj K. Pasam</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="26">Etienne Paux</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="27">Philippe Rigault</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="28">Josquin Tibbits</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="29">Vijay Tiwari</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="30">Manuel Spannagl</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="31">Daniel Lang</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="32">Heidrun Gundlach</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="33">Georg Haberer</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="34">Klaus F. X. Mayer</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="35">Danara Ormanbekova</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="36">Verena Prade</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="37">Hana Šimková</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="38">Thomas Wicker</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="39">David Swarbreck</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="40">Hélène Rimbert</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="41">Marius Felder</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="42">Nicolas Guilhot</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="43">Gemy Kaithakottil</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="44">Jens Keilwagen</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="45">Philippe Leroy</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="46">Thomas Lux</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="47">Sven Twardziok</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="48">Luca Venturini</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="49">Angéla Juhász</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="50">Michael Abrouk</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="51">Iris Fischer</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="52">Cristobal Uauy</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="53">Philippa Borrill</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="54">Ricardo H. H. Wulff</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="66">Moussa Benhamed</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="67">Abdelhafid Bendahmane</span>, <span data-delta="70">Jan Bartoš</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="71">Arnaud Bellec</span>, <span class="highwire-citation-author" data-delta="72">Hélène Berges</span>, <span             <p  class="highwire-cite-metadata byline"><em>Science</em><time>17 Aug 2018</time> </p>
                <div class="highwire-cite-snippet media__deck">
      <div class="highwire-markup"><div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" class="section precis" id="abstract-2" xmlns:xhtml="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><p id="p-5">The 21 annotated chromosomes of bread wheat provide a foundation for innovation in research and breeding.</p></div></div>    </div>

data-hide-link-title="0">Info & Metrics</a></li><li class="even"><a href="/content/361/6403/eaar7191/tab-e-letters" class="highwire-article-nav-jumplink" data-panel-ajax-tab="article_tab_eletters" data-is-tab-link="true" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0">eLetters</a></li><li class="last odd"><a href="/content/361/6403/eaar7191/tab-pdf" class="highwire-article-nav-jumplink" data-panel-ajax-tab="jnl_sci_tab_pdf" data-is-tab-link="true" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0"><i class="fa fa-file-pdf-o"></i> PDF</a></li></ul></div>  
</div>
    </div>
      </div>
</div></div>  </div>
  </div>
<div class="row row--alt row--promo">
    <div  class="region region-pre-footer pre--footer container--promo container">
    
  <div class="primary"><h2 class="subsection-title heading--block"><a href="https://science.sciencemag.org/content/current" target="_blank">Read the Latest Issue of <em>Science</em></a></h2>
  <div class="primary__main promo-foot--mag"><div class="promo-foot--current">
  
        
      <div class="highwire-article-citation highwire-citation-type-highwire-issue" data-pisa="sci;371/6526" data-pisa-master="sci;371/6526" data-apath="/sci/371/6526.atom" id="sci3716526atom"><h3>15 January 2021</h3>
<p class="promo-foot__meta">Vol 371, Issue 6526</p>
<a href="https://science.sciencemag.org/content/current" target="_blank" class="" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0"><img class="promo-foot__cover" src="https://science.sciencemag.org/sites/default/files/styles/sci_footer_promo_cover/public/externals/14067c1c7f0ec4e8744a44035d73cebe.gif?itok=6HXLnRKP" alt="Magazine Cover" /></a></div><p><a href="http://science.sciencemag.org/content/371/6526" class="btn--cta btn--cta--small" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0">Table of Contents</a></p>  
</div>
<div class="promo-foot--heds">
  
        
      <ul class="media-grid media-grid--2 media-grid--minor"><li class="first"><div class="highwire-article-citation highwire-citation-type-highwire-article" data-pisa="sci;371/6526/225" data-pisa-master="sci;371/6526/225" data-apath="/sci/371/6526/225.atom" id="sci3716526225atom"><h3 class="overline">Feature</h3>
  <a href="/content/371/6526/225" class="highwire-cite-linked-title" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0"><span class="highwire-cite-title">Fallen giant</span></a></div></li>
<li><div class="highwire-article-citation highwire-citation-type-highwire-article" data-pisa="sci;371/6526/239" data-pisa-master="sci;371/6526/239" data-apath="/sci/371/6526/239.atom" id="sci3716526239atom"><h3 class="overline">Biodiversity</h3>
  <a href="/content/371/6526/239" class="highwire-cite-linked-title" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0"><span class="highwire-cite-title">Tracking, targeting, and conserving soil biodiversity</span></a></div></li>
<li><div class="highwire-article-citation highwire-citation-type-highwire-article" data-pisa="sci;371/6526/242" data-pisa-master="sci;371/6526/242" data-apath="/sci/371/6526/242.atom" id="sci3716526242atom"><h3 class="overline">Climate Science</h3>
  <a href="/content/371/6526/242" class="highwire-cite-linked-title" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0"><span class="highwire-cite-title">Fighting the good fight</span></a></div></li>
<li><div class="highwire-article-citation highwire-citation-type-highwire-article" data-pisa="sci;371/6526/216" data-pisa-master="sci;371/6526/216" data-apath="/sci/371/6526/216.atom" id="sci3716526216atom"><h3 class="overline">SCI COMMUN</h3>
  <a href="/content/371/6526/216" class="highwire-cite-linked-title" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0"><span class="highwire-cite-title">News at a glance</span></a></div></li>
<li><div class="highwire-article-citation highwire-citation-type-highwire-article" data-pisa="sci;371/6526/230" data-pisa-master="sci;371/6526/230" data-apath="/sci/371/6526/230.atom" id="sci3716526230atom"><h3 class="overline">Coronavirus</h3>
  <a href="/content/371/6526/230" class="highwire-cite-linked-title" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0"><span class="highwire-cite-title">Herd immunity by infection is not an option</span></a></div></li>
<li class="last"><div class="highwire-article-citation highwire-citation-type-highwire-article" data-pisa="sci;371/6526/314" data-pisa-master="sci;371/6526/314" data-apath="/sci/371/6526/314.atom" id="sci3716526314atom"><h3 class="overline">Working Life</h3>
  <a href="/content/371/6526/314" class="highwire-cite-linked-title" data-icon-position="" data-hide-link-title="0"><span class="highwire-cite-title">No use in shouting</span></a></div></li>
</ul>  
</div>
</div><div class="primary__secondary">
